{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3364692,"name":"Antonio","username":"spaceZee","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/8c91f0/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-18T01:18:19.645Z","cooked":"

During our practice match our robot would lose connection for 4-10 seconds. This happened 6 times over the course of the match. Below is a photo of the radio placement.

IMG_06603024×4032 3.22 MB

After the match a field member came over and looked at the robot. He was not able to find any issues. The robot also has no issues tethered. We were given a new radio, but won’t be able to test it until tomorrow morning. I’m wondering if anyone else is having this issue or can suggest solutions.

P.S. I have very little knowledge about software and the person that does is still on a plane. I will do my best to answer any questions though.

You say “field staff”… was that a CSA (orange hat) or someone at the field itself?

Please seek on-site CSA support. If you havent yet, you can submit a support request at Request CSA Tech Support - FIRST Championship - NI Community (or scan the QR code at your inspection station or pit admin)

I know very little about robot radios. I do know that CMP is absolutely teeming with Vivid Hosting folks who are here just to help you out with stuff like this. I believe every division has someone from Vivid behind the inspection table (sometimes more than one person) so you should go over to your division’s inspectors and ask for them first thing tomorrow morning. Good luck!

We fought with this all season. It is caused by a network interruption between the radio and the Rio, such that the robot disables its actuators (a short timeout for safety) several seconds before the code receives a disable signal. In our case, it was static discharge to our network switch. Are you using a switch separate from the new radio?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-04-18T06:59:33.715Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":230,"readers_count":229,"score":131.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":463193,"topic_slug":"dropping-connection-during-practice-match","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/dropping-connection-during-practice-match/463193/7","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3364900,"name":"Thomas Lourenco","username":"Monjhall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/monjhall/{size}/162453_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-18T11:14:31.872Z","cooked":"

I second this. The short turn around time indicates the Rio and radio were likely powered, so their connection to each other was likely severed.

I’ve seen it be a network switch for some teams this season, but we had a similar issue with our practice robot in the shop. In that case it was just a bad Ethernet cord.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-04-18T11:14:31.872Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":56.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":463193,"topic_slug":"dropping-connection-during-practice-match","display_username":"Thomas Lourenco","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33946,"username":"Amicus1","name":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35972,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/dropping-connection-during-practice-match/463193/8","custom_user_title":"Software Engineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3364905,"name":"Roger","username":"RogerMCT","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rogermct/{size}/265955_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-18T11:30:16.897Z","cooked":"

You have a cable issue. You are quickly going between enabled and disabled so it isn’t a power issue. Check that all your ethernet cables are secured.

image1360×115 15.1 KB

I assume you’re at champs. Find a CSA (orange hat) to help you debug in person. You can most easily find them in the Robot Service Center area (loading dock side, behind the fields).

Apologies for the delay. As you can probably imagine, we’ve been fairly busy. Unfortunately the system does not provide a means of communication beyond showing up in your pit. I do see the request though, so someone will definitely be there this morning.

Hey here 5948 (Mexico team) we are having the same issue, our robot this season seemed to work perfectly during practice matches but when arriving official events, our robot seems to loose connection passing 1m of match. Any idea? We are currently working on the issue and it seems to be ram, but if anyone finds the logs usefull, i would apreciate the help.
